name: Aspirin
description: Aspirin is commonly used to relieve minor aches and pains.

name: Acetaminophen
description: Acetaminophen is used to treat mild to moderate pain and reduce fever.

name: Ibuprofen
description: Ibuprofen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve pain, reduce inflammation, and lower fever.

name: Antihistamine
description: Antihistamines are medications that treat allergy symptoms.

name: Cough Syrup
description: Cough syrup is a medication used to treat coughing and related conditions.

name: Decongestant
description: Decongestants are medications that relieve nasal congestion.

name: Antacid
description: Antacids are medications that neutralize stomach acid to relieve heartburn, indigestion, and upset stomach.

name: Antibiotic Ointment
description: Antibiotic ointments are used to prevent or treat infections.

name: Eye Drops
description: Eye drops are used to treat a variety of eye conditions, including dry eyes and allergies.

name: Antifungal Cream
description: Antifungal creams are used to treat fungal infections of the skin, such as athlete's foot and ringworm.

name: Laxative
description: Laxatives are medications used to relieve constipation.

name: Multivitamin
description: Multivitamins are dietary supplements containing a combination of vitamins and minerals.

name: Sunscreen
description: Sunscreen is a lotion, spray, gel, or other topical product that absorbs or reflects some of the sun's ultraviolet (UV) radiation and thus helps protect skin from sunburn.

name: Band-Aids
description: Band-Aids are adhesive bandages used to cover small cuts and wounds.

name: Hydrocortisone Cream
description: Hydrocortisone cream is a topical corticosteroid used to reduce itching, redness, and swelling associated with many skin conditions.

name: Thermometer
description: A thermometer is a device used to measure body temperature.

name: Nasal Spray
description: Nasal sprays are medications delivered through the nostrils to treat nasal congestion and other nasal symptoms.

name: Hand Sanitizer
description: Hand sanitizer is a liquid, gel, or foam generally used to decrease infectious agents on the hands.

name: Dental Floss
description: Dental floss is a cord of thin filaments used to remove food and dental plaque from between teeth.

name: Allergy Medicine
description: Allergy medicine is used to relieve allergy symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose, itching, and watery eyes.

name: Antiseptic Wipes
description: Antiseptic wipes are used to clean wounds and prevent infection.

name: Pain Relief Patch
description: Pain relief patches are medicated patches used to relieve pain, such as muscle pain or joint pain.

name: Digestive Enzyme Supplement
description: Digestive enzyme supplements are used to aid digestion by breaking down food into smaller molecules that are more easily absorbed by the body.

name: Motion Sickness Medicine
description: Motion sickness medicine is used to prevent or treat symptoms of motion sickness, such as nausea and vomiting.

name: Sleep Aid
description: Sleep aids are medications or supplements used to help people fall asleep or stay asleep.

name: Anti-Diarrheal
description: Anti-diarrheals are medications used to treat diarrhea.

name: Anti-Itch Cream
description: Anti-itch creams are used to relieve itching caused by insect bites, poison ivy, and other skin conditions.

name: Ear Drops
description: Ear drops are medications used to treat ear pain, ear infections, and earwax buildup.

name: Vitamin D Supplement
description: Vitamin D supplements are used to prevent or treat vitamin D deficiency.
